explanation: The air map of the area is the most crucial item for our survival in the Atacama Desert because it will help us navigate to the nearest settlement, the mining camp that is 50 miles away. Without a clear direction, we risk wandering aimlessly in the harsh environment, which could be fatal due to extreme temperatures and lack of resources. Knowing our exact location and the features of the terrain enhances our chances of reaching safety and finding potential sources of water or shelter along the way.
